meanings.definition: Twist or bend out of shape
meanings.sent1: She was intorting the wire to fit it through the small hole.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind intorted the tree branches during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The magician intorted his body into a pretzel shape to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist intorted reality in his painting, creating a surreal landscape.
meanings.sent5: The intense pain made her feel like her muscles were intorting uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: He intorted his face in a funny way to make his friends laugh.
meanings.sent2: The funhouse mirrors intorted their reflections, making them look silly.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intorted the truth in his jokes to make them more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The gossip intorted the facts, spreading false information.
meanings.sent5: The heat from the fire intorted the metal, warping it out of shape.

meanings.definition: To turn inward or curl up
meanings.sent1: The flower petals intorted as they dried up in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The cat intorted its body to fit into the small box.
meanings.sent3: The blanket intorted around him as he curled up for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The old book intorted at the edges from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar intorted into a cocoon before transforming into a butterfly.
